page.title: 14Inmos
page.content: The{Inmos microchip company}was built in 1982 by a man called Richard Rogers. It has one of the most advanced microchip production facilities in the world. It produces 2 million chips a month with a potential capacity of 5 million chips a month. The Duffryn site was chosen for the present development because it is in an attractive position, is a good size and has very good motorway connections. The workers can therefore have easy access. The building cost Â£11 million and was partially financed by the {British {Technology Group}. There are six departments:- production, back end, personnel, quality control and facilities. The silicon for the chips is imported from Japan. ( Continued on next page ) { }
